greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Positive integers, each occurring twice in the sequence, such that a(n) = a(k) when n+k = 6*a(n), starting with a(1)=1 and filling the next vacant position with the smallest unused number.
formula: a(6*a(n)-n) = a(n). Conjecture: Lim_inf a(n)/n = (3-sqrt(3))/6; Lim_sup a(n)/n = (3+sqrt(3))/6.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 11 2006
